== Distributions ==
== Distributions ==
â
[[Debian]]<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.keshi.org/moin/moin.cgi/PS3/Debian/Live |title=Debian|Live for PS3|accessdate=2007-03-04}}</ref>, [[Fedora (Linux distribution)|Fedora]] 8<ref>{{cite web | url=http://www.ps3coderz.com/index.php?option=com_content&task=view&id=119&Itemid=54 | title=PlayStation 3 Spin | accessdate=2007-10-07 }}</ref>, [[Gentoo Linux|Gentoo]]<ref>[http://whitesanjuro.googlepages.com Gentoo]</ref>, [[OpenSuSE]] and [[Ubuntu (Linux distribution)|Ubuntu]]<ref>[http://ubuntuforums.org/showthread.php?t=343113 Ubuntu]</ref> can be run on the PlayStation 3.<ref>[http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=_ZXcuhJkwx4 How to Install another OS (w/overvoice)]</ref> [[Yellow Dog Linux]] for the PlayStation 3 was first released for the PS3 in late 2006.{{Fact|date=March 2008}}<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.gamespot.com/news/6162316.html?sid=6162316|title=Yellow Dog Linux launches for PlayStation 3|date=2006-11-27|first=Emma|last=Boyes|publisher=gamespot|accessdate=2006-11-30}}</ref>
+
[[Debian]]<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.keshi.org/moin/moin.cgi/PS3/Debian/Live |title=Debian|Live for PS3|accessdate=2007-03-04}}</ref>, [[Fedora (Linux distribution)|Fedora]] 8<ref>{{cite web | url=http://www.ps3coderz.com/index.php?option=com_content&task=view&id=119&Itemid=54 | title=PlayStation 3 Spin | accessdate=2007-10-07 }}</ref>, [[Gentoo Linux|Gentoo]]<ref>[http://whitesanjuro.googlepages.com Gentoo]</ref>, [[OpenSuSE]] and [[Ubuntu (operating system)|Ubuntu]]<ref>[http://ubuntuforums.org/showthread.php?t=343113 Ubuntu]</ref> can be run on the PlayStation 3.<ref>[http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=_ZXcuhJkwx4 How to Install another OS (w/overvoice)]</ref> [[Yellow Dog Linux]] for the PlayStation 3 was first released for the PS3 in late 2006.{{Fact|date=March 2008}}<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.gamespot.com/news/6162316.html?sid=6162316|title=Yellow Dog Linux launches for PlayStation 3|date=2006-11-27|first=Emma|last=Boyes|publisher=gamespot|accessdate=2006-11-30}}</ref>
=== PSUbuntu ===
=== PSUbuntu ===
â
PSUbuntu [http://psubuntu.com/] is an [[Ubuntu (Linux distribution)|Ubuntu]] distribution able to run on [[Sony]]'s [[PlayStation 3]] platform. The installer cannot run in Live mode, but will offer an alternative installer (text-based) that will install a fully functional Ubuntu operating system. It is possible to have an external USB hard drive attached to the PlayStation 3 during install, and choose to mount that as the home folder.
+
PSUbuntu [http://psubuntu.com/] is an [[Ubuntu (operating system)|Ubuntu]] distribution able to run on [[Sony]]'s [[PlayStation 3]] platform. The installer cannot run in Live mode, but will offer an alternative installer (text-based) that will install a fully functional Ubuntu operating system. It is possible to have an external USB hard drive attached to the PlayStation 3 during install, and choose to mount that as the home folder.
â
Ubuntu Linux includes well-known [[GNU]]/Linux components such as free/open-source technologies such as [[Apache HTTP Server|Apache]], [[PostgreSQL]], and [[Python (programming language)|Python]]. The distribution also includes user applications, such as the [[Mozilla Firefox]] Web browser, [[OpenOffice.org]], [[Novell Evolution|Evolution]], [[Rhythmbox]], [[Pidgin (software)|Pidgin]], and [[GIMP]].
+
Ubuntu includes well-known [[GNU]]/Linux components such as free/open-source technologies such as [[Apache HTTP Server|Apache]], [[PostgreSQL]], and [[Python (programming language)|Python]]. The distribution also includes user applications, such as the [[Mozilla Firefox]] Web browser, [[OpenOffice.org]], [[Novell Evolution|Evolution]], [[Rhythmbox]], [[Pidgin (software)|Pidgin]], and [[GIMP]].
â
Ubuntu Linux is a derivative of Debian and relies on the Apt Package Manager, using .deb format. Through successive versions of Ubuntu every 6 months, more hardware support is added frequently. As a result, Ubuntu supports accelerated graphics hardware out of the box, although some other hardware components will not function properly without modifications to the kernel.
+
Ubuntu is a derivative of Debian and relies on the Apt Package Manager, using .deb format. Through successive versions of Ubuntu every 6 months, more hardware support is added frequently. As a result, Ubuntu supports accelerated graphics hardware out of the box, although some other hardware components will not function properly without modifications to the kernel.
